title: Canada Orders Air Canada Strike to Arbitration, Ends Travel Chaos
snippets: Canada's government forced Air Canada and its striking flight attendants back to work and into arbitration Saturday after a work stoppage stranded more than 100,000 travelers around the world.
Air Canada advises passengers not to go to the airport unless they have tickets on other airlines.
Jobs minister says full resumption of services could take days, arbitration means 10,000 cabin crew will return to work.

Canada’s government has forced Air Canada and the union representing flight attendants into arbitration after a work stoppage stranded more than 100,000 travelers around the world during the peak summer travel season
Jobs Minister Patty Hajdu ordered the sides to arbitration. The decision ended an hours-long strike that led the flag carrier to cancel hundreds of flights.
Ahead of the work stoppage, the airline said it had canceled most of the 700 flights that it directly operates, which carry about 130,000 people each day.
Ottawa orders binding arbitration to end Air Canada flight attendant strike, with Jobs Minister Patty Hajdu directing operations to resume after walkout disrupted global travel.
A complete shutdown will impact about 130,000 people a day, and some 25,000 Canadians may be stranded abroad daily. Air Canada operates around 700 flights per day.

CALGARY, Alberta — CUPE 4095 President Tyler McBain, CUPE Alberta President Raj Uppal, and AFL President Gil McGowan will address striking Air Canada flight attendants. Following this, members of the CUPE 4095 Strike Committee will be available for comment on the current Air Canada strike and
titles: Government forces Air Canada flight attendants back to work, into arbitration
What to know as Air Canada grounds flights and attendants strike
Government forces Air Canada into arbitration in bid to end strike
Government forces Air Canada and flight attendants back to work and into arbitration
Canada orders Air Canada flight attendants back to work, ending strike
Air Canada’s Flight Attendants Begin Strike, Crippling the Airline
Jobs Minister Patty Hajdu orders Air Canada and striking flight attendants back to work
Government forces Air Canada and flight attendants back to work and into arbitration, after strike strands over 100,000 travelers
Media Advisory for CUPE Air Canada Flight Attendants
summary: The Canadian government intervened in the Air Canada flight attendants' strike, ordering the airline and its striking employees back to work and into arbitration. This move came after the strike stranded over 100,000 travelers globally. Jobs Minister Patty Hajdu's decision aims to resolve the dispute and has led to the cancellation of hundreds of flights, affecting around 130,000 daily passengers. The full resumption of services is expected to take days, but the arbitration means that 10,000 cabin crew members will return to work, ending the work stoppage that significantly disrupted travel.

title: Trump-Putin Talks in Alaska End Without Ukraine Ceasefire Agreement
snippets: The US president will meet Volodymyr Zelensky in Washington on Monday in the wake of his Alaska summit with Vladimir Putin on Friday.
Warm welcome for Russia's Putin at meeting with US President Donald Trump in Alaska, but no deal on ending Ukraine war.

President Trump’s failure to reach an accord on Ukraine only made his warm welcome for the Russian leader more striking.

President Trump gave President Vladimir Putin a warm public reception, effectively ending his diplomatic isolation over the past three years for his invasion of Ukraine. But Mr. Putin did not agree to stop the war.

Despite a warm welcome from Trump, the talks concluded without reaching a ceasefire or any agreement to end the conflict. The meeting ended Trump's diplomatic isolation of Putin over the Ukraine invasion but failed to produce a solid outcome on stopping the war. title: Hurricane Erin Becomes First Major Hurricane of 2025, Targets Caribbean
snippets: Hurricane Erin exploded in strength to a Category 5 storm in the Caribbean on Saturday, rapidly powering up from a tropical storm in a single day, the National Hurricane Center said.
The "extremely powerful" storm "explosively deepened and intensified" overnight, say forecasters
Erin is the Atlantic season's first hurricane and is set to escalate over the weekend though the threat of direct impacts in the Bahamas and along the east coast of the US appears to be receding.

Erin becomes 2025's first major hurricane as storm intensifies
Erin has become the first hurricane of the Atlantic season with strong waves and rip currents possible along the East Coast of the United States as early as next week.

Erin not expected to make landfall, though nearby islands, including Puerto Rico, brace for flooding

Hurricane Erin has intensified into a category 5 storm as it churns its way over the Atlantic, brushing past islands in the north-e
The Atlantic’s first hurricane of the season had maximum sustained winds of 160 miles per hour, forecasters said.
Hurricane Erin gained strength Friday as it churned in the Atlantic Ocean and bore down on the Caribbean, where it could bring heavy rain to the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico.
titles: Hurricane Erin rapidly intensifies to a Category 5 storm in the Caribbean

summary: Hurricane Erin has intensified to become the first major hurricane of 2025. The storm is currently located in the Atlantic Ocean and is heading towards the Caribbean. It is expected to bring heavy rainfall to the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico.

As part of the preparation, Israel intends to relocate Palestinians from combat zones to southern Gaza, focusing on densely populated regions. This announcement follows concerns over rising airstrikes and malnutrition tolls. Additionally, families of hostages are calling for national protests in response to the situation.

title: Palestinian Woman Evacuated to Italy for Malnutrition Dies in Pisa Hospital
snippets: The woman was one of 180 Gazans evacuated by Italy in response to the humanitarian crisis

Marah Abu Zuhri, 20, arrived in Pisa on an Italian humanitarian flight along with other critical patients

A 20-year-old Palestinian woman suffering from severe malnutrition who was evacuated from Gaza to Italy this week has died, a hospital in Pisa has said.

The woman, named by Italia

MADRID (AP) — A 20-year old Palestinian woman described as being in a “state of severe physical deterioration” has died after being transferred to Italy for treatment, the hospital said Saturday. The patient was admitted to Pisa University Hospital late Wednesday and died on Friday. She was removed
titles: Malnourished Gazan woman flown to Italy dies in hospital
Malnourished Palestinian woman dies in Italy after Gaza evacuation
Woman from Gaza evacuated to Italy in a ‘state of severe physical deterioration’ dies in hospital
summary: A 20-year-old Palestinian woman, Marah Abu Zuhri, who was evacuated from Gaza to Italy due to severe malnutrition, has died in Pisa University Hospital. She arrived in Pisa on an Italian humanitarian flight, part of Italy's response to the humanitarian crisis in Gaza, and was admitted to the hospital in a state of severe physical deterioration. Despite efforts to treat her, Abu Zuhri passed away shortly after her arrival.

title: Trump Shifts to Seek Peace in Ukraine After Putin Talks, Ditching Ceasefire Plan
snippets: US president changes position on Ukraine, saying he prefers direct peace accord instead of ceasefire after Alaska talks.
Zelenskyy said he and Trump would meet Monday to "discuss all of the details regarding ending the killing and the war."
Trump said after meeting with Putin in Alaska the “best way” to end Russia’s war with Ukraine is “to go directly to a peace agreement,” and not a “mere ceasefire agreement.”

summary: After discussions with Putin in Alaska, Trump has shifted his stance on the Ukraine conflict, now advocating for a peace agreement rather than a ceasefire. This comes as the Ukrainian President plans a return visit to the White House, marking his first since a notable disagreement with Trump in February. Trump's new position emphasizes seeking a comprehensive resolution to Russia's war with Ukraine.

Jobs Minister Patty Hajdu directed the Canada Industrial Relations Board to take action, facing criticism from unions and opposition parties for allegedly favoring big business. This move aims to resolve the conflict and mitigate its impact on the economy.

title: Pakistan Floods: 400 Dead, Thousands Stranded in Monsoon Havoc
snippets: The majority of deaths were recorded in Pakistan's mountainous Khyber Pakhtunkhwa area.
Rescue efforts intensify in flood-hit villages as thousands remain stranded and death toll rises across Pakistan.

Floods triggered by cloudbursts and monsoon rains have killed around 400 people, with many more still missing, officials say. Rescue workers are desperately searching for survivors among the muddy debris.
titles: Flash floods kill more than 300 in Pakistan and Pakistan-administered Kashmir
Flash floods wreak havoc in northern Pakistan
Flash floods kill hundreds in Pakistan, India
summary: Floods caused by cloudbursts and monsoon rains in Pakistan have resulted in approximately 400 deaths, with a significant number occurring in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa region. Thousands of individuals are stranded as rescue operations continue in affected villages. Officials report many people are still missing, and efforts are underway to locate survivors in the aftermath.

Despite the lack of a ceasefire, Russian President Vladimir Putin extended an invitation to the US leader for a future meeting in Moscow. The outcome of the summit has been characterized by more questions than answers, with the US leader appearing subdued post-meeting.

title: Trump Proposes U.S. Backs Ceding Ukrainian Land to Russia After Meeting
snippets: After meeting the Russian president, President Trump told European leaders he now favors giving up territory Ukraine controls to Russia to end the fighting, a concession Ukraine has long opposed.
The U.S. president’s latest statements are a reversal of much of what he seemed to have agreed to with European allies this past week.
Achieving a peace agreement is an even higher bar than the ceasefire that has eluded the Trump administration in recent months.
titles: Trump Backs Plan to Cede Land for Peace in Ukraine

After welcoming Putin, Trump appears to adopt his goal, agreeing to cede land for peace
summary: President Trump, after meeting with the Russian president, proposed to European leaders that the U.S. should support ceding control of Ukrainian territory to Russia to halt ongoing conflict, marking a significant shift from his previous stance and agreements with European allies. This suggestion opposes Ukraine's position and complicates efforts towards achieving a peace agreement, which has been challenging to attain, even more than a ceasefire.

title: Putin Proposes Freeze on Ukraine Frontline, Challenges NATO Expansion

He has proposed halting Russian advances and maintaining the current frontline in Ukraine, where Russian forces control significant territories. This development comes as Ukrainian President Zelenskyy is scheduled to meet with former U.S. President Trump.

These troops, described as "skilled personnel," are prepared to respond but are not on a mission related to political policing, a veteran group clarified. This deployment aims to provide support as requested by the Trump team.

title: ASU Develops NasRED: Rapid Test Detects COVID, Ebola, HIV from a Blood Drop
snippets: Arizona State University scientists have unveiled NasRED, a revolutionary one-drop blood test that can detect diseases like COVID-19, Ebola, HIV, and Lyme with incredible speed and precision. Using gold nanoparticles to spot microscopic disease markers, the device delivers results in just 15 minutes
titles: A $2 gold nanotech test that detects deadly diseases in minutes
$2 One-Drop Blood Test Detects Hidden Diseases in 15 Minutes
summary: Arizona State University scientists have developed NasRED, a groundbreaking blood test capable of detecting diseases such as COVID-19, Ebola, HIV, and Lyme disease quickly and accurately. This innovative test, which requires just a single drop of blood, utilizes gold nanoparticles to identify tiny disease markers, providing results in as little as 15 minutes.

Jobs Minister Patty Hajdu defended the decision, stating it was necessary to protect jobs and maintain stability.

title: NASA's Perseverance Rover Sends Back Sharpest Mars Photos Yet
titles: Stunning New NASA Perseverance Rover Images Show Mars Clearer Than Ever Before
summary: NASA's Perseverance Rover has captured new images of Mars, providing clearer views of the planet's surface than ever before. These high-resolution photos offer detailed insights into Mars' geological features, aiding scientists in their research on the planet's environment and history. The images have been shared publicly, allowing for widespread access to the latest visual data from Mars.

title: Black Holes Studied as Cosmic Supercolliders in Dark Matter Hunt
titles: Scientists Eye Black Holes as Cosmic Supercolliders in the Hunt for Dark Matter
summary: Scientists are investigating black holes as potential cosmic supercolliders to detect dark matter, the elusive substance that makes up a significant portion of the universe's mass. This approach is based on the hypothesis that interactions around black holes might reveal dark matter particles, offering a new method to understand this mysterious component of the cosmos.

title: Brain's Aging Process Reassessed: Some Areas Improve Over Time
titles: Parts of the Brain Defy Aging and Even Improve Over Time
summary: Recent studies have shown that certain areas of the brain are more resistant to the effects of aging, with some parts even showing improvement over time. This challenges previous beliefs about the brain's aging process, suggesting that the cerebral cortex, in particular, ages less than previously thought. This discovery could have significant implications for understanding brain health and aging.

title: New Method to Restore Memory by Recharging Brain's Mitochondria Found
titles: How Recharging the Brain’s “Batteries” Restored Lost Memory
summary: Researchers have discovered a method to restore lost memory by recharging the brain's mitochondria, often referred to as the cell's "batteries." This breakthrough could lead to new treatments for memory loss associated with conditions like Alzheimer's disease. The study, focusing on the brain's capacity to recover lost memories rather than permanently losing them, represents a significant advancement in understanding and potentially reversing memory loss.

title: Great White Sharks Recover Globally, DNA Puzzles Scientists
snippets: Once on the brink during the last ice age, great white sharks made a remarkable recovery globally, but their DNA reveals a baffling story. Classic migration explanations fail, leaving scientists with a mystery that defies reproductive and evolutionary logic.
titles: Great white sharks have a DNA mystery science still can’t explain
summary: Great white sharks, nearly extinct during the last ice age, have made a significant global recovery. However, their DNA presents a mystery that contradicts traditional theories on migration, reproduction, and evolution, leaving scientists puzzled about the specifics of their resurgence.
